title: The Chodova Hotel spa where guests soak in baths filled with BEER for their skin
text:
56 shares 7
View
comments
Beer and baths don't normally go hand in hand but this spa has created the ultimate boozy experience - filling their baths with dark beer.
The baths at the Chodova Hotel in the Czech Republic have become the talk of legend as guests can quite literally bathe in beer - and it's good for you too.
The beer allegedly opens up skin pores and purifies tired parts of the skin, providing vitamin B and crucial proteins and, of course, guests can enjoy a pint while they bathe.
Scroll down for video
A woman bathes in and drinks beer at Chodova Hotel in the Czech Republic, where visitors treat their ale-ments from the inside and out
The beer allegedly opens up skin pores and purifies tired parts of the skin, providing vitamin B and crucial proteins
Guests can unwind with a pint, or even bring along a friend to enjoy the hoppy experience with them
Mojmír Prokes, of Chodova Hotel said: 'The baths are a real feature and we're really proud of them.

'We recommend that guests stay in them for about 20 minutes and after that they're invited to the relaxation area covered by a sheet and a fleece quilt.
'People come out of the experience feeling relaxed, purified and rejuvenated and their skin feels healthy.'
The dark beer is produced in a traditional way based on the original method of brewing Chodovar - with beer yeast, hops and a mixture of dehydrated crushed herbs.
It costs 660 CZK (£17.86) for a 20-minute session soaking in the beer, followed by a 20-minute relaxation period with the sheep fleece blankets.
The bath water is covered with a characteristic beer foam of a caramel colour, with the area scented by the fragrance of freshly brewed dark beer
The beer is prepared in a rehabilitation tub from water and mineral water and poured at a temperature of 34 degrees Celsius
Sessions cost 660 CZK (£17.86) for a 20-minute soaking in the beer, followed by a 20-minute relaxation period with the sheep fleece blankets
The idea came about ten years ago and was inspired by an old tradition - at the end of their shift, the youngest apprentice would pour a jug of beer into Albi's bowl - Albi being the dog on the hotel's emblem.
It was believed that the spirit of Albi bathed in the beer overnight and kept the taste fresh to bring good luck to the brewery.
Nowadays, the family brewery in Chodova Plana deals with malt production, beer production and bottling mineral water.

The Chodova Hotel in the Czech Republic offers a range of treatments and spa experiences alongside the beer baths
THE BREWING TREND: THE BEER SPA IN CZECH REPUBLIC The custom baths usually fit one or two people, but these women squeeze four in as one pours another glass of beer at the Beer Spa
The benefits of bathing in beer have been proven since the Middle Ages, claims another Czech Republic spa at which amber nectar is the star of the show.
The Beer Spa in Prague allows guests to have a dip in a bath filled with the all-natural ingredients used for beer brewing, including barley, hops and yeast, kept at a steady 37 degrees Celsius and continuously bubbling to 'promote dissolution of ingredients', releasing vitamins, carbohydrates and proteins, the company claims.
During a 30-minute bar and bath session spa-goers can pour as much of the company's home-brewed Beer Bernard as they can consume from tub-side tap before continuing their relaxation session on a heated bed or with a 20-minute massage.
The £80 per person treatments are sold as a chance to 'treat your body from inside and outside' and leave visitors invigorated at the end - they also advise for the full benefit of the beer to be achieved users shouldn't shower for 12 hours after their visit.
'It is very old and unique spa therapy, where only natural materials are used,' the company says. 'The beer served in the Beer Spa is produced using a traditional technique from the best variety of Czech hops.
The beer baths fit couples or singles and if the experience wasn't beer-soaked enough by the end, each visitor gets a bottle of Beer Bernard as a parting souvenir.
The home-brewed Beer Bernard flows from the tub-side tap while the whirlpool-style bubble bath distributes healthy products
Unlimited beer can be consumed during the 30-minute beer baths, poured from a tap alongside the tub
